page.title: 06THE POLICE
page.content: The village of Rookhope is a very law-abiding village.It is policed by members of the Durham Constabulary, operating from a sectional Police Office some six miles away. Until the late 1950's the village was policed by a residential policeman (Village Bobby). Criminal offences of burglary, theft and vandalism are very rare and are committed usually by persons other than residents of Rookhope. Since the decline of the lead and fluorspar mines the village is of a rural nature which leads to the offences of poaching and sheep worrying.
